channel.title: What should i do with my career?
channel.description: Hey guys, i am going through bit of a bind right now. All my life i have been very interested in going the Marines or Navy Seals or even the National Guards as iv always enjoyed to help people and taking pride in making people happy. I am wanting the roll in combat BUT, Im extremely good with computers so my family and everyone says "if you go into the armed forces, you need to join the technical side" But the thing is, im not really interested with the technical stuff. I think i would have more fun in combat and exploring the world. I am just going as a freshmen in highschool this year and i know i have a long time to think but who thinks what would be better for me? Note: I love to work out <3 :D Push-ups in a minute: 62 Sit-Ups in a minute 42 Pull-Ups Max: 19 Max Running distance so far: 4 Miles Straight

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

You’re a big moron if you think going into the military is going to be good for your family…

Read full topic
item.source: What should i do with my career?

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

FromAutumnToAshes:

Thanks guys, i am mostly setting my mind to the Marines branch in combat. Im just hoping that the benefits are good as well, i know it pays for college and stuff but- I’m just hoping that i am able to give my family a good life as well once i start one :). And also, i have been wanting to join JROTC all the way through middle school but it turns out Sellersburg Indana schools do not have a JRTOC program which was kind of a put down to me.

I don’t see how putting your life on the line every day is something beneficial for your family. But you’re free to do whatever you want with your life so, go right ahead.

Read full topic
item.source: What should i do with my career?

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

FromAutumnToAshes:

Thanks guys, i am mostly setting my mind to the Marines branch in combat. Im just hoping that the benefits are good as well, i know it pays for college and stuff but- I’m just hoping that i am able to give my family a good life as well once i start one :). And also, i have been wanting to join JROTC all the way through middle school but it turns out Sellersburg Indana schools do not have a JRTOC program which was kind of a put down to me.

If you want to give your family a “good life”, you will most likely want to consider even going into the military, because it will occupy a good bit of your life, especially if you put into active service.

Read full topic
item.source: What should i do with my career?

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:21, topic:525877”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=644620.msg4337339#msg4337339 date=1374592951]

Screw all that stuff you listed, grab a bear costume and start raving at parties (and they pay you)! It’s got all the action you would ever want and you would need to keep working out to “be fit for the job”.

He said Career, not job.

Career: An job undertaken for a significant period of a person’s life.

and with opportunities for progress.

If you’re going to quote Google, don’t try to cut words out to make it fit what you are trying to say.

Life full of opportunities, I though that part was common sense. You don’t know nothing about that job so I don’t know why you’re talking like you do unless you have first hand experience.
[/quote]
You’re right, I don’t know “nothing”. I know something.[/quote]
your names are so close to each other, so close you can taste it.
Have you thought about tasting each other?

FromAutumnToAshes:

Thanks guys, i am mostly setting my mind to the Marines branch in combat. Im just hoping that the benefits are good as well, i know it pays for college and stuff but- I’m just hoping that i am able to give my family a good life as well once i start one :). And also, i have been wanting to join JROTC all the way through middle school but it turns out Sellersburg Indana schools do not have a JRTOC program which was kind of a put down to me.

Veterans have alot of advantages in life. But keep in mind (idk alot but) If they are required in war… and needs drafts
you might be forced in. You might die or be a disabled veteran. It’s very dangerous once you are in war. No way out

Read full topic
item.source: What should i do with my career?

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:18, topic:525877”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=644620.msg4337306#msg4337306 date=1374588830]

Screw all that stuff you listed, grab a bear costume and start raving at parties (and they pay you)! It’s got all the action you would ever want and you would need to keep working out to “be fit for the job”.

He said Career, not job.

Career: An job undertaken for a significant period of a person’s life.

and with opportunities for progress.

If you’re going to quote Google, don’t try to cut words out to make it fit what you are trying to say.
[/quote]Name a job where there isn’t room to progress?

I’ve seen janitors become managers…[/quote]
I’m not talking about Janitors. I’m talking about a self employed beer bear that goes to parties to make money with no actual schedule or sense of job security. Obviously in this economy there is very little job security, however as a beer bear there really can never be a promised sense of security in one’s job. Nor is there an opportunity to advance in a corporate ladder. However this entire discussion is completely off topic and not what OP is looking for so I suggest we end it here and continue on with the actual subject.

Read full topic

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Fire capez, post:11, topic:525877”][quote author=Host Gushers link=topic=644620.msg4337214#msg4337214 date=1374568372]
Why are you asking us what YOU should do with YOUR life…
Do what you enjoy doing and is a well paying job to support yourself and your family (if u have children etc)
[/quote]

yeah do whatever the fudge u want[/quote]
Ever heard of a guidance counselor? That is basically what he is asking the community to be. to give their views on possible careers he could have. Obviously in the end it is what he wants to be, but it is always good to hear from people around your age, as well as those who already have careers, to see what may or may not persuade him to a specific career.

Read full topic

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

HcoJustin:

Navy isn’t too bad, you definitely won’t easily become a seal though. Score high on the asvab and you’ll do just fine

Only problem really with Navy is you’re liable to get sent out to sea for months at a time… If you don’t mind being on a boat that long then I guess you’re fine.

Read full topic

item.source: What should i do with my career?

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Marines are the last place you want to go, you get treated like shit, because that’s what you are to them.

You sound more like you’d rather go out and play with death making a low-ish wage than actually go in the military to make a living, which is a bad idea IMO.

I’d suggest joining the Air Force, better living conditions, you get to keep your life, and when you join as an officer you get paid pretty well.

http://www.military-ranks.org/air-force/captain-pay

You are guaranteed the rank of Captain (O-3), after 4 years in the service.

And what’s this about you saying you would have “fun” in combat? No you wouldn’t. Nobody does, talk to mostly any enlisted marine. They almost always get out after their 4 year term is up because they don’t wanna go back to that. Its rough out there.

You’ll go in all gun ho and come out lucky to be alive, if you do.

As for the Navy, iirc it isn’t that easy to become a seal, you have to work like hell, much longer than your 4 years to get to that point.

tl;dr: No Marines, no Navy, no National Guard, Air Force is the best road, Army is far behind in 2nd.

Read full topic
item.source: What should i do with my career?

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I’m going to get tons of shit for it, but the guard is a joke. If you are going to serve, please pick a better branch. You won’t actually ever get a chance to help anyone, and it’ll just be a let down if that is truly why you want to join.

Read full topic
item.source: What should i do with my career?

item.title: What should i do with my career?
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“FromAutumnToAshes, post:1, topic:525877”]Push-ups in a minute: 62
Sit-Ups in a minute 42
Pull-Ups Max: 19
Max Running distance so far: 4 Miles Straight[/quote]
You’re going to be doing a lot more than that in a single day if you join the service.

FromAutumnToAshes:

I love to work out <3

Yeah, that will definitely change once you join.

Read full topic
